meanings.definition: Unpleasant, dirty, or of poor quality.
meanings.sent1: The grotty alley was filled with trash and old newspapers.
meanings.sent2: The bathroom in that restaurant was so grotty, I didn't want to use it.
meanings.sent3: Even the rats found the grotty cheese in the dumpster unappetizing.
meanings.sent4: Her once beautiful dress now looked grotty after being dragged through the mud.
meanings.sent5: The grotty smell coming from the old fridge made everyone cringe.

meanings.definition: A feeling of disgust or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The grotty in his stomach grew as he saw the moldy sandwich.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't shake off the grotty she felt after watching the horror movie.
meanings.sent3: The grotty in the room was palpable as they entered the haunted house.
meanings.sent4: The grotty of failure weighed heavily on his mind before the exam.
meanings.sent5: The grotty of betrayal lingered in the air between them after the argument.
